newsitem.title: GERMANY: Kohl cites women, immigrants in jobless rate.
newsitem.headline: Kohl cites women, immigrants in jobless rate.

text.p: Chancellor Helmut Kohl said about two million of the three million new jobs created in western Germany in the last decade had been filled by women.

Speaking in parliament, Kohl said that the percentage of women working in western Germany had climbed from 46 percent in 1970 to 60 percent currently. The increase in the number of women in the workforce had had an clear impact on the job market, Kohl said.
"The consequences cannot be overlooked," Kohl said.

Kohl said a contributing factor to high unemployment was the large number of foreign immigrants in Germany. He said that there were 1.1 million immigrants in Germany in 1995, more than even the 720,000 who immigranted to the United States in that year.
